title: Publish the app to a stable live Internet Computer URL and provide the final HTTPS link

requirements.text: Deploy the existing app as a production (non-preview) Internet Computer deployment and capture the final stable HTTPS URL that users can open in a browser.
acceptanceCriteria: A production/live deployment is performed (not a preview/draft link).
A stable HTTPS URL for the deployed site is produced and recorded as the live link for the project.
The live URL opens in a browser without showing an "Unknown domain" error (allowing for normal certificate propagation delays).

requirements.text: Update frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md to include complete, copy-pastable steps to deploy to the Internet Computer mainnet and to retrieve/confirm the final live HTTPS URL after deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md includes end-to-end commands to deploy to mainnet (IC) from a clean environment, including prerequisites, build, deploy, and verification steps.
DEPLOYMENT.md explicitly documents how to obtain the final live HTTPS URL for the frontend canister after deployment and how to verify it loads.
DEPLOYMENT.md notes that SSL/certificate propagation can take time and suggests a retry window if the URL initially fails.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.

Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Adding new product features unrelated to publishing/deployment.
Integrating third-party hosting providers or external databases.
Changing authentication beyond existing Internet Identity setup.
